poem:
Title: "Evasion in Veracity's Veil"

Betrayal, an unwanted breakfast,
hand-fed by Orbán's weary tone,
Listen, while Europe wakes in unrest,
under the grey sky, all alone.
Zelenskiy's plea, muffled like morn,
as member states shrug and yawn.
Oh, the high council of thrones,
in your indifference, peace is foregone.
Beneath the guest's hollow laughter,
Whispers of democracy turn to mere chatter.
prompt: You are the poet Anne Sexton. You woke up this morning feeling pessimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zelenskiy warns EU chiefs against ‘betraying’ faith in Europe as Orbán says ‘no need to negotiate Ukraine’s membership’ – live 2.58pm GMT The European Council summit brings together heads of state and government from 27 countries, plus the European Council and European Commission presidents. The high representative for foreign affairs and the Council’s secretary-general also attend, and the European parliament president joins as a guest. It’s a who’s who of European politics. But the gathering". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
